jobTitle: Business Development Manager- Scania Finance Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50583994.txt	§Business Development Manager- Scania Finance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Development Manager- Scania Finance§§Advertiser: §Scania NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Other§§§§§§ §Life at Scania§Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. We offer sales and services in more than 100 countries with production units located in Europe, South America and Asia.  Scania is at the forefront of technology, development and manufacturer of our new generation vehicle range, trucks, buses and engines - our overall purpose is to DRIVE THE SHIFT towards a sustainable transport system.§Scania Finance is a wholly owned subsidiary of Scania CV AB Sweden. We have been in operation in Australia for a little over 4 years and have 15 global business units covering 51 markets worldwide, Scania Finance is a global organisation with its own treasury funds.§What you will do §We work directly with our OEM partner (Scania New Zealand) to provide tailored and flexible financing solutions to customers. You will be responsible for attracting and managing a profitable business for Scania Finance New Zealand.§Prospect and increase the number of new business leads§Maximize conversion to new business and promote total transport solution selling§Present customer financial information to establish credit limits§Develop effective sales planning and strategy§Provide sales reporting§Focus on portfolio growth while driving profitability margins§Support Scania New Zealand Account Managers, sales network and Management§Meet with Scania clients to negotiate finance deals§Work with Credit Risk team to asses creditworthiness§Credit Administration§Who you are§To be successful as a Business Development Manager within our organisation, we believe that you will most likely have formal qualifications in Business or related discipline. You will have relevant business knowledge and experience gained from financial services sector. Knowledge of the commercial vehicle industry will be highly regarded.§What we can offer you§A dynamic and inclusive work culture - be part of a great team environment§Be part of the bigger picture - a company with a focus on digitalisation, autonomous vehicles, electrification and sustainability§A company that is growing with potential for career progression§As part of our usual recruitment process applicants will be required to undergo pre-employment testing, police checks and medical examination§To apply§If you want to join a dynamic company with strong values, if you want to be more than a number and have a real voice, join us and start an exciting career in an international company. Hit the “§Apply now§” button and submit your CV. Should you require further information, you can contact §careers@scania.co.nz§You need to be an Australian / New Zealand citizen or a permanent resident to apply for this role.  §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Senior Financial Plan Writer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50588791.txt	§Senior Financial Plan Writer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Financial Plan Writer§§Advertiser: §Westpac§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Financial Planning§§§§§§Senior Financial Plan Writer§§Westpac on Takutai Square, Auckland§Full Time, Fixed term- 7 months§Consumer Banking & Wealth§§How will I help?§As part of the Financial Planning team you will work closely with the Financial Advisers and Private Wealth teams to provide and peer review Financial Plans as well as providing support and guidance to lift capabilities to enable good customer outcomes. § §In this role you will demonstrate One Team by also work with the PremiumPlus team directly in providing not only financial plans but other advice documents to ensure our customers get the best outcomes possible.§ §What is in it for me?§Being part of a company where you are valued as an individual, able to put you mark into our customer experiences. With financial benefits for being part of the Westpac team (like special banking, wealth and insurance offers), you will also be able to develop so your career can grow as you do.§ §You will join a team where you can work across boundaries as One Team to lead the market through service excellence and anticipating customer needs.§ §What do I need?§3+ years Financial Services Industry experience§AFA qualified or working towards - preferred§Graduate Diploma in Personal Financial Planning or NZ Certificate in Financial Services (level 5)§Experience working with XPLAN software or similar - preferred§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§What is it like to work there?§§We are passionate about people and take pride in building teams that reflect the diversity in our communities. From day one, we will invest in your growth and empower you to take ownership of your ongoing learning and development.  As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market, gain access to a suite of online learning modules and career planning tools to grow with us, as well as our industry-leading superannuation programme and fantastic staff banking package. § §Next Steps§Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter through the link on this page. § §For more information, please get in touch with §Tasha.patel@westpac.co.nz§ §Please note: we are happy to answer your questions but we do not accept applications by email.§ §We appreciate your interest in a future career with Westpac, however, due to current border restrictions brought about by Covid19 and uncertainty around when this will change,  we are unable to support visas for offshore applicants at this time.§§§§

commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit directly to the public, and managing the staff involved in the day to day delivery of those services§Providing advice and guidance to the loan workers, debt coaches and loans administrators, including in relation to preparing budgets, loan applications and debt reduction plans§Establishing processes to provide consistently high levels of client service in a cost-effective manner§Managing client expectations and continuously improving Good Shepherd NZ’s service delivery to its clients§Overseeing loans and loan book administration and reporting for Good Shepherd NZ’s phone-based microfinance programmes§Maintaining strong and collaborative working relationships with the community partners who also deliver Good Loans, and banking, corporate and government partners§About You§This role is well-suited to people who can point to experience:§combining personal lending and/or financial mentoring experience in financial services, family budgeting or consumer lending§with a passion for We focus on providing top performance, great service and valuable advice to Kiwis. § We were founded in 2012 after seeing a need in the market for simple to understand KiwiSaver investment advice for New Zealanders. Over the last three years, Generate has had one of the fastest-growing memberships of any KiwiSaver provider and now approximately 90,000 Kiwis are enjoying the benefits of Generate.  § §About the role§ An outstanding opportunity has become available for one of either a Fixed Income Portfolio Manager or Fixed Income Analyst to join the Generate team.  As the Fixed Income Portfolio Manager, you will lead the day-to-day investment of the Fixed Income portion of our portfolios delivering consistently outstanding trading execution for our clients. If you are at an Analyst level, you will be supported by the Lead Portfolio Manager as you further grow you career and expertise with us. § §You will: § § §utilise your market and investment expertise to maximise the risk adjusted returns of our funds and develop relevant innovative investment strategies§ §define and drive strategic initiatives with an entrepreneurial and client centric mindset. § §Drive our credit research and grow trading in offshore corporate bonds and securitised bonds. § § Additionally, you will have the opportunity to be involved with (or set up and run - depending on your level of expertise) one of three new funds scheduled for next year. § § §To add to our high performing team, you will bring:§ § §4-8+years experience in fixed income trading (4+ for the Analyst role and 8+ for the Portfolio Manager role)§ §Good analytical experience, preferably in corporate bonds § §An interest & expertise in trading (rather than more of a sales focus) § §Experience researching and/or trading in the NZ market.  § § Familiarity with the Australian Market would be helpful and experience with securitised bonds is also advantageous. § § You will be highly motivated and goal-oriented with excellent relationship building skills – and have a genuine love for what you do. §About the benefits §You will join a down-to-earth team where you will regularly enjoy a laugh, celebrate each other’s successes and be rewarded for your achievements. We are a nimble and fast-moving organisation that listens to the ideas of its staff. We live our values of honesty, openness and supporting our people every day. §You will be joining a successful, award winning business on a growth trajectory and a slice of the action will be available to you with an opportunity to purchase shares in the business. § To apply for this position, please click the 'Apply Now' button below and send us your CV supported by a cover letter.    Applications close as soon as the ideal candidate applies, but no later than Tues 6th October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Over the last 145 years we've supported thousands of families and businesses to look after what is important to them.§We couldn't do this without our Trustees, who connect with our customers to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions. If you are empathetic, can build relationships with a wide range of people and are commercially savvy, then you could be the perfect fit for our well-established team of Trustees.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not become a Trustee at Public Trust?§About the role§We are seeking a potential Senior Trustee to join our customer centre in Christchurch.§Our Senior Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Associate and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future.§In this varied role, you will support the support the Principal Trustee on more complex files, while coaching and mentoring our Associate Trustees on less complex work. You will work with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide training, however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are integral to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§Several years' experience in a role that has involved providing exceptional customer care in emotionally challenging situations§Experience coaching, mentoring and collaborating with a wider team§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Experience as a trustee or legal executive or in a corporate or administrative role is preferred§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Trustee.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 145 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them.§By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including; legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection.§We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Wednesday 14th October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50656591.txt	§New Clients Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§New Clients Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Christians Against Poverty§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Management§§§§§§Apply here: §https://capnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=23&source=aWQ9MTY%3D§ § § §About the organisation and the role§ §Is God calling you to use your leadership experience to serve His Kingdom here in Aotearoa?§ §Christians Against Poverty (CAP) partners with over 200 diverse churches across the nation, equipping them to reach their communities and transform lives. CAP’s mission began with Debt Help – a free service through which families are freed from the oppression of debt into a life where they are in control of their finances.§ §As New Clients Team Leader, you and your team of seven ensure that clients get the best possible start in their journey out of debt. Your New Enquiries staff welcome brand new callers, make sure CAP’s service is right for them, and get them connected with their local partner church. Then a little later in the journey, your Client Setup team creatively overcome practical and financial hurdles to put together a workable budget that will set the client and their family up for success – and eventually, complete freedom from unmanageable debt.§ §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § §Lead and develop a healthy, engaged and effective team§ §Constantly seek to grow and improve the quality and long-term effectiveness of clients’ early interactions with CAP§ §Problem-solve and smooth the path for your team, responding appropriately to internal and external concerns or complaints§ §Monitor and report on the team’s performance against targets§ §Work closely with other leaders within CAP to ensure different areas of the organisation are united and working together effectively§ §Skills and experience§ § §At least 3 years’ experience in leading a team to achieve results§ §Experience with personal finance and budgets§ §Proven leadership ability – uniting a group to achieve a common goal§ §Experience working with people from a range of cultural backgrounds§ §Awareness of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and its role in providing respectful service to clients§ §A drive to improve processes so that they best serve the desired outcomes§ §Genuine and holistic care for the people you lead§ §A team player, willing to work with other leaders and make sacrifices to achieve the organisation’s wider goals§ §Commitment to growing your own resilience and leading others to do the same§ §Strong personal commitment to CAP’s Core Values – to serve the poor, save the lost, with the church, across Aotearoa§ §Job benefits and perks§ § §Lead and grow your team of 7 to serve clients with compassion and excellence§ §Join with just over 50 staff, all passionate about Christ’s ability to transform lives§ §Work/life balance supported and encouraged with generous leave and TOIL§ §Be encouraged in your Christian faith, while being part of a team that is changing lives§ §Important Application Details§ §If you can’t wait to jump on board to: §Serve the Poor, Save the Lost, With the Church, Across the Nation§ then the CAP team can’t wait to hear from you!§ §PLEASE NOTE:§ You must complete a CAP application at the below link in order to apply for the role. Applications received via SEEK alone will not be considered.§ §To apply, copy and paste this link into your browser:§ §https://capnz.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=23&source=aWQ9MTY%3D§ §Please apply by §Wednesday 14 October§.§§§§

Ability to efficiently and effectively acquire regulatory knowledge.§Demonstrated ability to work productively with regulatory bodies and to lead and manage complex and probing regulatory examinations to ensure best outcomes are achieved for the firm.§Proven ability to provide sound rationale to influence and persuade Executive Stakeholders in the decision making process§Relevant degree and at least 5 years’ experience, some of which is in privacy or data protection from a legal, regulatory, compliance or operational perspective, and/or technology and information security skills§Superior verbal and written communication skills, in conjunction with proven ability to form strong relationships across large organisations and to influence and lead change§Proven ability to work seamlessly across large and complex organisations and to facilitate the effective and efficient flow of information through the organisation§§Some of our other benefits include:§§Banking benefits§Subsidised healthcare§Flexible working opportunities§§About ANZ§Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality. § §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§ §The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.§ §Integrity – We are honest and fair§Collaboration – We work together for the customer§Accountability – We take ownership and get things done§Respect – We care for all those we serve§Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better§ §We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you§.§ §ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world. § §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit anz.co.nz/careers.§ §You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number NEW041896. § §Applications close Thursday 15 October 2020. §§#GD4.1§§§§§§

Biosurgery, Author-it, Vend, Unleashed Software, Coretex, Mobi2Go, Timely, Park Help and Revolution Fibres.§  § §  §Job Purpose§  §The Investment Manager is a critically important role within the Movac team, and is actively involved in assisting and supporting the Partners in all areas of investment and portfolio management.§  §This opportunity has arisen due to an internal promotion.§  § §  §Main Accountabilities§  §Management: § § §Oversee the Analyst team in all aspects of their roles§ §Assist with goalsetting and performance reviews for the Analyst team§ §Investment Analysis: § § §Lead the development of detailed operating models of entrepreneurial companies § §Create modelling of capital structure scenarios and return analyses to support investment decision-making§ §Perform market research and competitive analysis, with structured findings and results § §Draft investment cases and business plans to support the investment process  § §Due diligence and transaction documentation: § § §Represent Movac in transactions, including negotiating term sheets, co-ordinating deal documentation, legal reviews and legal transaction administration  § §Collaborate with legal counsel, accountants,  auditors and other service providers to manage investment opportunities through to closing § §Portfolio company growth:  § § §Support Movac Partners’ in their roles on portfolio company boards § §Provide business analyst assistance to portfolio company management in support of value enhancing initiatives§ §Support portfolio company fundraising efforts and strategic partnership development by producing investor presentations, drafting marketing and diligence material, and engaging co-investors§ §Fund management:§ § §Assist with monitoring portfolio companies through review of reports and interaction with company management § §Assist with preparation of Fund reports§ § §  §Background / Experience§  §To be considered for the role you must have at least 5 years of investment, financial analysis and/or business modelling experience, and have leadership experience in deal execution. Candidates must be able to represent Movac in commercial negotiations and manage relationships with key stakeholders.§  §Applicants may have worked in venture capital, private equity, investment banking or management consulting, but those who have gained the necessary experience from other industries (such as operators in senior start-up roles) will be considered.§  §An excellent academic record, evidence of an enquiring nature, and ability to ‘think outside the box’ analytically will complement your work experience.§  §In addition to the above experience, Chartered Accountants, CFA charterholders and those with an MBA or equivalent post-graduate qualification, may be at an advantage.§  §Evidence of a curious nature will complement your work experience.§  § §  §Technical Skills / Competencies§ § §Deal execution and transaction leadership§ §Financial modelling and Financial statement analysis§ §Market research§ §Commercial Acumen§ §Information Gathering§ §Strategic thinking§ §Analysis and judgement§ §Excellent communication skills – verbal and written§ §Expert-level Excel modelling and Powerpoint presentation skills§ §Strong relationship management skills – networking, influencing, collaborating§ § §  §You must be an energetic self-starter capable of working with limited direction, whilst managing multiple projects to strict deadlines, to excellent levels of accuracy. You must be able to manage specific projects and people independently, and drive to commercially-orientated conclusions based on evidence and insight.§  §Meticulous attention to detail, self-motivation and tenacity are essential traits, as well as a sense of humour in order to perform in a demanding environment.§  § §  §Key Relationships§ § §Movac Partners§ §Movac Investment & Community Manager§ §Movac Analysts§ §Movac Finance Manager§ §Portfolio and prospect company management§ §External legal counsel and accounting firms§ §If you are not available to legally work in New Zealand immediately, or you don't have work experience and skills that match what we're looking for above, please don't bother applying as your application will likely be ignored.§  §Applications close 5pm Friday 16 October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Operations Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50676084.txt	§Senior Operations Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Operations Analyst§§Advertiser: §ANZ Bank New Zealand Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Other§§§§§§ § §Utilise your Mainframe Operations expertise to help manage and optimise ANZ’s core mainframe development and production systems§ § § §Take the lead in designing and refining reliable processes and procedures that ensure stable systems§ § § §Technically review processes and procedures to reduce manuality and enhance automation wherever possible§ § § §About The Role§ § §This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Mainframe Operations Specialist to take the lead in managing and enhancing all aspects of the processes and procedures associated with the Development and Production batch systems.§ § § § § §In this role, you will have the opportunity to:§ §Develop, test, support, maintain and monitor Control-M scheduling for Batch, Reporting and File Transfers on Mainframe and Distributed (server) platforms§ §Provision the SDLC (Service Delivery Life Cycle) environments (Production/System Test/Operational Acceptance Testing (OAT)/Performance and Verification (P&V) and Education) for Systematics and VisionPlus§ §Technically review, analyse, enhance and improve processes and procedures, with a focus on automation to reduce manuality, ensuring maximum efficiency and accuracy for the Operations Analyst Team§ §Monitor and support Production and Development batch executions across all platforms and resolve incidents§ §Design, develop, maintain, refine, automate and document reliable processes and procedures that ensure stable systems and batch - ensuring these processes are presented in a format that is clear and simple for the user to follow§ §Maintain own high skill levels of all Operations Analyst team processes, tools and deliverables, understand other team processes and mentor colleagues in these, to mitigate knowledge risk.§ §Role Location: §Wellington§ §Role Type: §Full Time, 6 months, Fixed Term§ §Hours: §Standard business hours with scope for flexible work options§ § §About You§ § §You will be a seasoned mainframe specialist with extensive knowledge of IBM mainframe architecture and system software. You will have had at least 5 years’ experience as an Operations Support Analyst, Shift Operator and/ or a Systems Programmer in an IBM z/OS Mainframe Operating Environment.§ § §To grow and be successful in this role, it is essential for you to have a demonstrably high level of skill and understanding in the following areas;§ § §Scheduling of Batch across Mainframe and Distributed platforms using IOA Control-M and Control-M/EM software§ § § §File Transfer Protocols - specifically Connect Direct§ § § §JCL coding of TXT, Procs and Parms§ § § §Endevor § § § §Production Batch Monitoring and Support§ § § §Criticality of batch SLA and Incident Record handling§ § § §Importance of Change Record management§ § § §IBM Operating System, CICS, Utilities and Msg Queues§ § § §IBM Mainframe Storage and file and record formats § § § § §Nice to have:§ § § §IOA Control-D§ § § §IOA Control-B§ § § §Some of our other benefits include:§ § § § §Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave§ § § §Staff Banking and Insurance benefits§ § § §Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career§ § § §Southern Cross Health Insurance§ § §To find out more about what it is like to work in ANZ’s Technology team watch this short video:§ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6ccJeITDTc&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR0laTpfWblMpT3vKZMqMOEleQpRwKOEJZvrS4KnQYou6Y8k_qkdtOZBxms § § § §About ANZ§ § §Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.§ § § § § §ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.§ § § § § §The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.§ § § § § §Integrity – We are honest and fair§ § §Collaboration – We work together for the customer§ § §Accountability – We take ownership and get things done§ § §Respect – We care for all those we serve§ § §Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better§ § § § § §We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.§ § § § § §ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world.§ § § § § §To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit http://www.anz.co.nz/careers§ § § § § §You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number §NEW042102§.§ § §Applications close 16 October 2020 although we reserve the option to withdraw the ad should sufficient suitable candidates apply prior to closing date.§ § §Please note, because of the urgency of this role and current COVID-19 related NZ Border restrictions, applications will only be considered from those that have a current, indefinite and unrestricted right to work in New Zealand. § § §** No sponsorship or visa support can be provided at this time. **§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50678478.txt	§Debt Coach - Microfinance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Debt Coach - Microfinance§§Advertiser: §Momentum Consulting Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Credit§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Debt Coach - Microfinance §    §      §About the Company§ Our client, Good Shepherd New Zealand, is a member of a worldwide organisation concerned with creating a more emotionally, economically, and physically safe world for women. Its objective in New Zealand is to support better futures for women, girls and their whanau who are experiencing disadvantage.§ A significant area of focus is on supporting the development of financial inclusion and microfinance programmes for New Zealand families living on limited incomes. Believing it is the right of all to have access to fair and affordable credit, Good Shepherd NZ work with key stakeholders including community-based organisations, corporate partners (including two commercial banks providing loan capital) and government to achieve that goal.§ Domestic microfinance is becoming more recognised in New Zealand as a fair and safe alternative in the small credit market, and Good Shepherd NZ is currently in the process of expanding its microfinance programmes to meet the need that recognition creates.§ § §About the Role§ The Debt Coach is primarily responsible for providing specialist ‘budgeting’ advice and debt advocacy services to clients experiencing financial hardship across New Zealand. This is a telephone-based role. The Debt Coach works across two similar programmes which Good Shepherd NZ is currently delivering.§ The Debt Coach assists clients referred by its community-based Loan Workers and a network of Financial Mentors from around the country. The Debt Coach assists clients with unsustainable existing debt, advising and assisting them in developing and implementing debt reduction plans, which may also include a loan to consolidate and/or refinance their existing debt.§ The Debt Coach reports to the Service Delivery Manager – Microfinance and works closely with Loan Workers and Financial Mentors across the country, and with the wider Good Shepherd NZ team and microfinance partners.§ Based in Good Shepherd NZ’s Central Auckland office alongside other phone-based Debt Coaches, phone-based Loan Workers, and the broader microfinance team, the phone-based debt coaching service currently operates between 8.30am and 6 pm.§ This is a full time fixed-term role until 30 June 2022, however more flexible arrangements could be considered for the right individual.§ § §About You§ To perform well in this role, applicants will point to experience in: §        §          §Working as a financial mentor, loan worker, budget advisor, debt counsellor and/or financial coach§          §Handling casework, referrals and advocacy on behalf of clients with diverse backgrounds and sometimes complex needs§          §Working with diverse cultures and communities and understanding the needs of clients§          §Relevant financial capability and consumer credit legislation and processes (for example, KiwiSaver, Insolvency etc.)§          §Negotiating and working with lenders to reduce client debt§          §Working in a predominantly telephone and email-based role (not seeing clients face to face), with an excellent telephone manner and listening and questioning skills coupled with the ability to identify client needs and establish effective relationships§        § Experience within a Not-For-Profit organisation would be beneficial, but it is not critical. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and with an increasingly agile workforce drive flexible working to get the best out of our people. At PwC, we aim to inspire, motivate and reward our people to succeed in all areas of their lives.§§What next?§If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. jobText: TXT/50703974.txt	§Investment Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Investment Manager§§Advertiser: §Jasmine Social Investments§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Other§§§§§§Jasmine Social Investments is a foundation established by Sam Morgan and his family following the sale of Trade Me to Fairfax in 2006. Our mission is to identify high performing social ventures led by stellar individuals and take them to the next level by providing assistance, capital, and access to skills and networks. We also try to play a useful role in philanthropy by sharing our work with similarly minded funders around the world.§  §We strive to deeply understand organisations - their management and board, financials, metrics, plans and impact.  We look for organisations who can articulate a clear vision and their vision for impact at scale. We provide results-oriented funding (mostly grants, sometimes equity or debt) and we advocate strongly for those we fund within our wider network of funders and talent.§  §You will lead a subset of funding relationships, look for new investment opportunities and work with social entrepreneurs and philanthropists. This is a rare opportunity to work in global philanthropy and have a hand in shaping the future of Jasmine Social Investments.§  §Key responsibilities will include:§ § §Source and evaluate funding opportunities (grants/debt/equity).§ §Make recommendations with regard to funding decisions.§ §Conduct financial analyses and other research to support the portfolio review process.§ §Write grant making reports that are shared internally and externally.§ §Continually assess the social impact, scalability, and capacity of investees to deliver results.§ §Build and sustain high-value relationships with Jasmine investees.§ §Connect organisations in the portfolio to each other and to other useful actors.§ §Develop relationships with other donors, thought partners and sector leaders.§ §Represent the Foundation externally as required.§ §To be successful in this mid-level position, you will bring a strong foundation of analytical skills, a history of problem solving and the commitment to creating social change through others. The ideal candidate will have 5-10 years of relevant experience, a compelling and concise writing style and some international exposure. MBA or advanced degree in a relevant field is preferred. Big pluses include work in venture philanthropy, impact investing and/or a social enterprise.§  §We are a small team with a big agenda and the energy of a start-up. We don't waste time, keep formal meetings to a minimum, and often collaborate with people in different time zones. You must thrive in a high-performing environment, be an avid technology user, and be able to work independently. Above all, you must be enthused about working with outstanding social ventures who are solving a basic need of the very poor.§  §Please send a CV and a paragraph (just one please!) as to why this job is a good fit for you.  Candidates for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§  §Direct inquiries only please - no agencies.§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50712969.txt	§Customer Service Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative§§Advertiser: §TSB§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §Rest of Taranaki§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Banking - Retail/Branch§§§§§§Who are you?§We are looking for a Customer Service Representative to join our Hawera Branch. jobText: TXT/50720548.txt	§Financial Modeller§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Financial Modeller§§Advertiser: §Deloitte - NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Competitive Salary§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Corporate Finance & Investment Banking§§§§§§We’re looking for a talented and motivated Senior Analyst with strong financial modelling expertise to join our Business Modelling Team within our Corporate Finance practice in Wellington.§  §Key aspects to the role include:§ § §Developing high quality financial analysis, primarily in Excel, but also other platforms such as VBA, data visualisation tools such as Tableau or PowerBI and relevant database languages when appropriate§ § Attention to detail, curiosity and a passion for problem solving are important, and critically, strong communication skills to develop dashboards, model documentation and to present key analysis insights to senior decision makers§ § Managing client projects, developing strong business relationships, and delivering outstanding service to a diverse portfolio of clients§ §Project management skills and inter-personal skills§ §Responsibility for managing day-to-day interactions with the client and other team members§ §About the team§  §The Corporate Finance Team delivers Transaction Services, M&A and Valuation services and a broad range of Commercial Advisory work. Our Commercial Advisory work supports public and private sector organisations throughout the entire lifecycle of infrastructure and service delivery projects. Our modelling team supports clients to develop the financial analysis tools that support strategic decision making, through to project delivery including the provision of commercial, financial and transaction advisory services, infrastructure development, commissioning and contestability, economics and business case development. §  §Enough about us, let’s talk about you. You are someone with:§ § §Two years financial modelling experience preferably in either a consulting or advisory environment§ §Developing and reviewing quantitative and qualitative analysis to support decision making§ §High degree of proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience in one or more of the following platforms would be advantageous: VBA, PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx, database languages§ §Strong oral and written communication skills to capture user requirements and prepare model design specifications, user guidance, model documentation; or to develop analysis to inform a range of client deliverables such as information memoranda, investment/business cases, feasibility analysis or transaction analysis§ §Attention to detail§ §Experience in model validation and review processes§ §Drafting well-structured, evidence based and persuasive reports suitable for a variety of audiences including government and industry§ §Next Steps§  §Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.§  §If you’ve got any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this role, contact Kate Park from the Talent Acquisition team at §09 303 0792§. We’d love to hear from you!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50728950.txt	§Accounts Payable Transformation Support x 2§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Accounts Payable Transformation Support x 2§§Advertiser: §Metlifecare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Other§§§§§§Account Payable Transformation Support x2§Are you thirsty for a challenge?§Love working with data?§Do you want to learn Accounts Payable? Or grow on your already established experience?§Do you want to play a part in helping us create a World Class Accounts Payable Team?§Come join the Metlifecare family.§About the role§Our Accounts Payable department is going through major change. We want automation, automation, automation. Is it clear, automation is our goal?§Reporting to the Accounts Payable Manager, the 2 x AP Transactional Support roles are newly created to cover transactional AP work and provide project assistance for the work we are about to embark on. We have two 12mths fixed term roles available.§While a big part of these roles is all about delivering the AP BAU work, which is important in its own right, collaboration with the AP Transformation Leads to aid the multiple project, improvement and efficiencies we have to accomplish is key. These roles will play an integral part in providing reporting and analytics that will drive insight to the changes we need to make.§If you've a thirst for data management, pulling the information, getting the answers and understanding the reporting and analytics around what will make the function work better, smarter, efficient - then this well might be the challenge for you.§Every role has its challenges right!? Change at pace, balancing BAU with the projects are but a couple you'll face. We've set some lofty goals so it's going to be challenging, rewarding and exciting all at the same time. There is no getting bored around here, there is constant change.§These roles are a unique opportunity to step into a fascinating industry and to get to know the many complexities of the retirement sector.§These roles are based in our Support Office in Newmarket and we encourage you to come and find your feet in the finance world and continue to grow your career with us.§About you§You're passionately curious and can work independently yet collaboratively within the team. You'll have previous experience where you can demonstrate you've had the customer at heart. Resilience to adapt to a changing environment will be something you're keen to have more exposure to, daily!§You might be a recent graduate in finance and keen to put your degree to good use. Having gained some work experience would be ideal, where you can demonstrate your attitude to learning as well as your ability to make connections in your thought process. A positive attitude is key to reflect your proactive, adaptable and resilient self.§We use Greentree so previous experience of this system is naturally an advantage, but if you've utilised another system and can learn quickly - we'll invest in training you. Having strong skills in excel would be integral to your success. Any other experience/training that will enable your impact on reporting and support your ability to work with data sources to comprehend and make meaning of the data, will help you stand out above other candidates§About us§Right now, more than 5,500 people call Metlifecare home. With this number set to increase, so will the opportunity to be part of creating meaningful growth.§Established in Auckland in 1984, Metlifecare has a proven track record of successfully owning and managing retirement villages in New Zealand. Metlifecare currently owns 25 villages in prime locations throughout the North Island of New Zealand, with most providing a full continuum of care. Our villages are designed with our residents' personal freedom and sense of security in mind, with living options ranging from independent villas and apartments through to serviced apartments, assisted and hospital level care.§How to apply§If you're looking for your first step into an accounts payable team, can make sound connections between processes and keen to use your financial analytical skills in supporting the automation projects, we want to hear from you. Simply apply below!§§§§

This specialist team extends our ongoing commitment to Know Your Customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Counter Financing Terrorism (CFT) and Customer On-Boarding obligations, ensuring compliance while at the same time making these processes as easy and simple as possible for our customers.§We are currently have a §6 months and a 9 months Fixed Term§ opportunity for a §Team Leader§ to join our team of specialists, responsible for supporting our customers with AML/CFT compliance and the on-going customer due diligence of simple and complex entities and individuals. Being available when it suits our customers, means we run an extended hours operation (10:00 am to 10:00 pm NZT). As such, the team operate a rotating roster system with some flexibility around hours.§The role§Reporting to a Manager within International Operations you will be responsible for the day-to-day leadership of your team. You will lead, coach and motivate staff to drive performance, providing clear direction to enable your team to deliver unbeatable customer experiences at all times.§Your team of specialists will be responsible for customer due diligence compliance, advice and support, ensuring our procedures are efficient and effective. Key is ensuring a strong understanding, and providing sound guidance to our teams, to minimise operational and reputational risk.§What you will do§Lead and develop a dynamic team, dealing with a high volume of external and internal customer contact; alerts; exceptions and/or cases with varying levels of complexity and multiple technical processes across all products, channels, brands and jurisdictions.§By championing productivity disciplines lead, develop, promote and implement strategy in relation to the efficient cost effective management of varied ongoing customer due diligence obligations and protocols.§Maintain team performance and a dynamic work environment where open communication and coaching opportunities enable people to develop and succeed. Ensure staff retention is kept within agreed levels.§Ensure service levels and standards are maintained across multiple brands through continued training of staff, including accuracy and productivity.§Support multiple brands across various jurisdictions through:§Ensure adherence to KPIs within leadership and of all reporting staff§Effective management of complaint handling and complex queries§Manage teams that operate a 12 hour rotating roster§Proven ability to effectively manage staff that mostly work from home§Liaising with customers to fulfill regulatory obligations,§Analyse and interrogate data received from various systems, customers and other sources to identify and verify customers§What you will bring§Proactive and proven people leadership skills with previous experience leading, coaching and managing staff in a high demand environment§Growth and continuous improvement mind-set, with experience in leading teams through rapid change and continuous improvement in complex environments.§Proven experience in work force planning and productivity planning§Sound knowledge and experience of regulatory operations divisions such as Customer On boarding of both individuals and complex entities, and our obligations in relation to AML and CFT legalisations§Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate complex concepts for different audiences§Experience in managing various internal and external stakeholders and stakeholder expectations§Minimum 5+ years' banking experience with a sound understanding of risk operations functions§If you are ready to take the next step in your career and you want to make this role your, we are keen to hear from you!§CommBank is committed to great Customer Experiences and building a diverse and inclusive workforce reflecting the customers and communities we serve. As a purpose led organisation, we support our people through focusing on skill and talent development, collaboration, flexibility and internal promotion. We offer an open and inclusive culture, a place where we welcome and value your individuality, ideas and goals. Our high-performing team of subject matter experts based in Auckland plays an important role in securing and enhancing the financial well-being of people, businesses and communities.§§§§

We’re looking for a new Financial Systems and Projects Analyst to join our awesome team based in Newmarket, Auckland. § § § § §Is this your next role?§ § This a role that uses your understanding of systems and processes as well your financial analysis skills to improve and enhance Heartland’s financial reporting functions. You’ll work across the Finance team to identify information needs, process bottlenecks and work to develop automated solutions to improve reporting timeframes and accuracy. You’ll work closely with our Data & Analytics team to further develop our reporting capability and make sure these meet our ongoing needs. You’ll be involved in the development and maintenance of Heartland’s credit provisioning and stress test models as well as developing other financial models as required. You’ll also be involved in the development of Heartland’s core systems, ensuring all Finance requirements are identified and addressed.§ § §Does this sound like you?§ § You’re a critical thinker, curious, and keen to learn. You’ll have an understanding of financial systems and processes and experience using datasets and developing financial models. You have an investigative mind, hungry to dive in and fix things. You have the ability to analyse issues, identify options, draw sound inferences, determine and recommend practical courses of action using innovation, creativity and good judgement. Happy to roll your sleeves up and turn your hand to any task, you’re flexible and work at pace.§ § You’re a pro:§ § §Experience and knowledge of financial control and accounting§ §Experience of systems implementations§ §Process management experience§ §Knowledge of finance business processes and general accounting including revenue and expense management, accounts, financial planning, and analytics§ §Financial analysis/financial mathematics skills§ § § §A bit about us and what we do§ § Heartland is an NZX/ASX-listed financial services group with big growth plans.  Heartland owns both Heartland Bank in New Zealand and Heartland Seniors Finance in Australia.  We provide award-winning savings and finance products to a diverse range of customers including business owners, farmers and retirees.  Through Heartland Digital, we build and deliver seamless and flexible digital platforms to create the best experience for our customers.§ § § § §Can you see yourself here?§ § We’re innovative and always evolving.  We work together as one team and have big ambition.  We’re committed to creating a culture of inclusivity that celebrates our diverse backgrounds and supports the wellbeing of our people. § We offer real opportunities for learning and career development.  You can also drive change through our internal groups (including Manawa Whenua - our Māori group, rainbow committee, wellbeing and sustainability groups).  Some of our other benefits include:§ § §an excellent insurance package§ §employee banking perks§ §Te Reo Māori lessons§ §sports teams including touch, netball and football§ §daily breakfast, fresh fruit and Friday night pizza and drinks§ § § § § §Keen to learn more?§ § For an insight into life at Heartland, check out our Instagram @heartlandbanknz. § § Please note you must be eligible to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What is your experience of financial control and accounting?§What is your experience of systems implementations?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What is your expected annual salary?§§§

busy environment and embracing the Westpac Way of Working.§  §About the role:§§ §We have a fantastic opportunity to support our dedicated three lines of defence model, with this role facilitating the embedment of first line of defence for the Consumer Experience Hub (including product, marketing, analytics and digital teams).§  §This role is pivotal in transforming the way we manage risk and continuously drive improvements across the business units risk and compliance environment. §  §Components of the role will focus upon:§ §Embedding WNZL’s operational risk management and compliance From a comprehensive network of over 110 offices located in regional, rural and metropolitan areas, we combine local knowledge with world class technology to help you on your financial journey.§ §Our vast geographical footprint and team of over 3,000 principals, professionals and support staff provides you access to expertise across the entire range of financial services, ensuring more than just financial advice.§ §The Opportunity § §As a Senior Commercial Lending Adviser at Findex you will be responsible for building quality relationships both internally and externally in order to create a robust lending referral network in Auckland and beyond.§ §As a Senior Commercial Lender, you will represent Findex and will be responsible for packaging commercial loan transactions for our Findex customers and presenting them to funders.  § §You will be able to negotiate terms with funders and ensure that you are meeting all the external (Bank) and internal credit and risk guidelines. § §Your initiative and drive will be recognised and rewarded in this outstanding career position.§ §This is an exciting role to build and grow a business that will provide longer terms management opportunities, and deliver significant rewards for the right candidate.§ §Key Responsibilities§ § §Managing, developing and promoting Findex offering, ensuring that growth, profitability and customer service targets are met within required standards.§ §Identifying potential and future transactions and submitting proposals to funders on behalf of clients. paid parental and partner leave, Employee Assistance Program and wellbeing benefits such as vaccinations and health insurance discounts§ §Next Steps:§ §If you are interested in joining our fast-growing company and your skills meet the above criteria, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking 'Apply’§ § §§§§

This is naturally a leadership role, without the accountability (although could be in time!) and is designed to release the Accounts Payable Manager to focus on team and project management activities. We've set some high reaching goals so it's going to be about working collaboratively with the Accounts Payable Manager, and the rest of the team to make it happen. There is no getting bored around here, there is constant change and it's all about you embracing this and being that change agent in the business.§These roles are a unique opportunity to step into a fascinating industry and to get to know the many complexities of the retirement sector.§These roles are based in our Support Office in Newmarket and provides a development pathway to the Accounts Payable Manager role - so seize the opportunity.§About you§A change agent by nature, you're passionately curious and can think innovatively and implement change with speed. You'll have a strong understanding of the Accounts Payable process, ideally around the 5 years mark coupled with systems implementation, improvement and automation of Accounts Payable Systems. We use Greentree so previous experience is naturally an advantage, but if you've utilised other system(s) and can learn quickly - we'll invest in training you. Needless to say, being an excel guru up to the level of at least pivot tables etc is part of your toolkit.§You'll be proactive by nature and a driver of continuous improvement. If you don't like change, this role isn't for you! Have we talked enough about change yet!! You'll be able to show us in your previous experience your ability to be an advocate for change and promote process improvement and business change projects.§Your past experiences reflect your proactive, adaptable and resilience self. But equally able to crucially think and problem solve. There is stacks to do, so you'll relish high volume, multiple task management and multiple stakeholders asking you for information. This means your interpersonal skills across all levels is second to none, including clients and suppliers.§You'll be able to show us your strength in solution focused initiatives, have the customer always front and centre and be able to work independently and as part of a team.§About us§We'd love you to join us and be a part of shaping our World Class Accounts Payable function. What we actually do is help individuals, families and business owners understand what financial risks may be in their lives, and how to fix the problem. We provide advice, protection and often give direction. Our clients often become our friends and its a role where we are often told "thank you" from our clients.§ §We offer clients advice regarding KiwiSaver (and believe me when say that more than half the people you meet won't understand how it really works, what extra benefits it provides or how most Kiwis get it so terribly wrong).§ §Also advice on life insurance type products, including medical insurance, Income protection, mortgage protection, disability cover and more. § §We have agencies with all the main insurance providers in NZ so you are able to offer people the absolute best option available for their situation.§ §If you make the cut, then you'd be part of an empowering and supportive team that will help you grow and earn well in your new career, while at the same time making a significant difference for others.§ §Who are we?§ §We've been helping clients since 1987, so are well established and have helped thousands of customers. We provide a complete Financial Advice service including§ § §Education in §KiwiSaver§ and what to do (and what not to do) so as to help people become secure in their retirement. Plus how to help use it for a first home deposit, or how to potentially double your end result compared to using a default provider & no advice.§ §Mortgage finance and Home loans§ with access to great mortgage deals with over 31 lenders.§ §Financial protection for Kiwi's§, their families, and businesses through quality personal risk insurance. We have agencies with all the major insurers so we can offer the best solutions for each client.§ §No experience is required as we provide full training, mentoring from a Senior Adviser, administration back-up and all the essential things you need to succeed.§ §The hours are flexible and once you are up to speed you have the opportunity to work from home for much of what we do.§ §All you need is a positive attitude, a willingness to learn and a passion to help others.§ §This is a commission only role with no cap on your income. So your income is not limited by a salary. But you can earn quickly and we have had new Advisers earn six figure incomes in their first year. It is up to you.§ §If you're prepared to put in the effort to succeed and to follow our advice and systems, then we will help you achieve great results.§ §And what about COVID-19? Well it certainly hit hard for many industries, but financial advisers were still able to crank it up and keep earning, flipping from mainly face to face meetings, to online Zoom calls etc. In fact it doesn't matter what the economy is doing, people always need advice, always need insurance, are always having children or have family or themselves to protect, and are always buying homes or refinancing. So most people you meet in life are potential clients. § §After the initial training period you'll have a lot of independence and autonomy, you can work from home if that is attractive to you, or from our comfortable office in the Ellerslie Village.§ §If having a satisfying career with flexible hours and excellent earning potential sounds like something you’d like to explore, then send us your CV and Cover Letter.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50783744.txt	§Finance Business Partner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Finance Business Partner§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Finance Business Partner §      §        §          §Exciting opportunity to showcases your exceptional relationship management skills and business acumen§          §Be responsible for your own business portfolio from an end to end perspective§          §Drive discussions wider than just finance and challenge the status quo to improve outcomes for the business§          §Fixed-term position to July 2021§          §Salary range $110K - $135K depending on experience§        §        § §        §About the role:§        §The Finance Business Partner role is a role that reports to the Manager Finance Business Partnering within the Finance Business Partnering branch of F+P.  The Finance Business Partner would partner with the business and with the Manager Finance Business Partnering to set the direction and drive the implementation of the business group's financial strategy while ensuring alignment with the overall Ministry strategic plan and stated outcomes. §        §They would use their extensive financial expertise to work with the Manager Finance Business Partnering to lead the effective financial management, and would provide support for the non-financial management, of the business groups. This would be achieved through aligning with the business and providing accurate, high quality, multi-year strategic financial advice to influence the strategic and operational decision making process. §        §The role would provide authoritative financial advice, effectively influence senior stakeholders in addition to providing assurance to the Senior Leadership Team that financial management processes, procedures and reporting comply with legislative requirements and best practice.§        §We are looking for candidates that can hit the ground running with demonstrated significant experience in management reporting within large, complex and diverse organisations.§        § §        §Skills and Experience:§        §To be successful in this role you will have:§        §          §Strong experience in driving outcomes and managing diverse stakeholder interests§          §Significant experience in leadership roles§          §Strong strategic financial management experience within a large, complex and diverse organisation§          §Strong analytical, strategic and planning skills as well as being commercially savvy§          §Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and ability to articulate complex messages clearly, simply and concisely§          §Ability to establish and maintain positive and successful working relationships§          §Strong team player and ability to collaborate and contribute at senior leadership team level§          §High standards of professionalism and performance driven§        §        § §        §Applicants must be New Zealand citizens or New Zealand permanent residents and be CAANZ qualified or equivalent§        § §        §About the branch:§        §The Finance Business Partnering branch, which sits within F+P, works in partnership with business groups, supporting them to deliver their services effectively and efficiently, allowing the Ministry to achieve its outcomes. The Finance Business Partnering branch is the conduit between F+P and the business groups.§        § §        §Why work for us?§        §MBIE is one of New Zealand's largest, most influential and most diverse public sector agencies.  This means that we are able to offer significant opportunities for developing experience across a broad range of areas.§        §We aim to create a culture where our people are empowered to bring fresh ideas and perspectives and to develop new approaches.§        §We also take the time to foster a work environment that is enjoyable for all.  This means we like to collaborate, support and encourage our people, encourage excellence and innovation and take the time to have some fun and celebrate our successes.§        § §        §About MBIE:§        §MBIE is the lead agency for making it easier for business to work with government.  MBIE's purpose is to grow the New Zealand economy to provide a better standard of living for all New Zealanders.  We do this by working with others to help businesses to be more competitive, improving job opportunities and by ensuring quality housing is more affordable. §        §Our way of working is guided by our values which shape our behaviours. §        §          §Mahi Tahi - Better Together§          §Maia - Bold and brave§          §Pae Kahurangi - Build our Future§          §Pono Me Te Tika - Own It§        §        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website.  You may view a position description at this site, as well as complete the on-line application, and upload a CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process. §Applications sent by email will not be accepted.§        §Please e-mail Jo Smith at joanne.smith@mbie.govt.nz quoting reference MBIE/1490617 if you have any further questions.§        §Applications close at 5pm on Sunday 1st November 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Exciting opportunity to showcases your exceptional relationship management skills and business acumen§§Be responsible for your own business portfolio from an end to end perspective§§Drive discussions wider than just finance and challenge the status quo to improve outcomes for the business§§Fixed-term position to July 2021§§Salary range $110K - $135K depending on experience§§ §§About the role:§The Finance Business Partner role is a role that reports to the Manager Finance Business Partnering within the Finance Business Partnering branch of F+P.  The Finance Business Partner would partner with the business and with the Manager Finance Business Partnering to set the direction and drive the implementation of the business group's financial strategy while ensuring alignment with the overall Ministry strategic plan and stated outcomes. §They would use their extensive financial expertise to work with the Manager Finance Business Partnering to lead the effective financial management, and would provide support for the non-financial management, of the business groups. This would be achieved through aligning with the business and providing accurate, high quality, multi-year strategic financial advice to influence the strategic and operational decision making process. §The role would provide authoritative financial advice, effectively influence senior stakeholders in addition to providing assurance to the Senior Leadership Team that financial management processes, procedures and reporting comply with legislative requirements and best practice.§We are looking for candidates that can hit the ground running with demonstrated significant experience in management reporting within large, complex and diverse organisations.§ §Skills and Experience:§To be successful in this role you will have:§§Strong experience in driving outcomes and managing diverse stakeholder interests§Significant experience in leadership roles§Strong strategic financial management experience within a large, complex and diverse organisation§Strong analytical, strategic and planning skills as well as being commercially savvy§Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and ability to articulate complex messages clearly, simply and concisely§Ability to establish and maintain positive and successful working relationships§Strong team player and ability to collaborate and contribute at senior leadership team level§High standards of professionalism and performance driven§§ §Applicants must be New Zealand citizens or New Zealand permanent residents and be CAANZ qualified or equivalent§ §About the branch:§The Finance Business Partnering branch, which sits within F+P, works in partnership with business groups, supporting them to deliver their services effectively and efficiently, allowing the Ministry to achieve its outcomes. jobText: TXT/50783862.txt	§Senior Product Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Analyst§§Advertiser: §Northpower Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Banking & Financial Services§, §Analysis & Reporting§§§§§§The role§Reporting to the Commercial and Regulatory Manager, you’ll support the end to end delivery of electricity distribution products to retailers and consumers. Supporting the development and implementation of product and pricing strategy for the electricity network.§This role will see you providing analysis, insights and recommendations to support strategy, pricing and product development as well as financial and consumer outcomes. This will involve you building and running financial models and reporting on key metrics, including budgeting, forecasting and variance analysis, and working across both the organisation and externally to deliver product and pricing changes, including embedding updated systems and processes. It will also involve managing contracts with key customers, and contributing to regulatory processes.§About us§Northpower is a New Zealand owned electricity and fibre network provider for Whangarei and Kaipara, with more than 60,000 connected customers. We also provide contracting services to our partners – other network owners and operators across the North Island.§We have over 1,300 staff working together across 13 locations to keep the power on and the lights going for our customers.§What we’re offering§The opportunity to work for a purposeful, essential organisation in an interesting meaningful capacity§An environment where innovation and adaptation is forefront§A friendly place to work where people are valued and appreciated§Competitive remuneration and various other benefits including an in-house wellbeing programme, with initiatives such as group discounted medical insurance and discounted gym membership§Who we’re looking for§An individual with some experience in product management, or analytical experience ideally in the electricity, telco or banking industries§Ideally with a degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics§Someone with strong analytical thinking capabilities, who is a great listener with a meticulous eye for detail§Strong interpersonal skills, preferably experienced in working in a multi-cultural environment§Get in touch!§If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of our team, we’d like to hear from you!§Applications close 6th November!§Due to current border restrictions, unfortunately applications from international candidates or those without the right to work in New Zealand cannot be considered.§Northpower has an in-house recruitment team who manage recruitment for all our vacancies. If you're interested in a role with us we would encourage you to apply directly online to us, as we don't accept candidates via agency (unless the role is advertised by the agency at our request).§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
